alert.note: Alert for Hillsborough (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 03 at 9:43AM EDT until September 05 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... Alafia River At Lithia affecting Hillsborough County. Peace River At Arcadia at SR 70 affecting DeSoto County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Myakka River At Myakka River State Park affecting Sarasota County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Florida... Horse Creek Near Arcadia at SR 72 affecting DeSoto County. .Heavy rainfall over the last week has caused rivers to rise into Flood Stage. Most will be continuing to recede over the next few days. For the Alafia...including Lithia ...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Myakka...including Myakka River State Park...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Peace...including Zolfo Springs at SR 17, Arcadia at SR 70... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Alafia River at Lithia . * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Additional residences downstream of County Road 640 bridge begin flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 14.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM EDT Sunday was 14.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 6.3 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.4 feet on 12/27/2002. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Fri Alafia River Lithia 13.0 14.4 Sun 9 am 13.5 12.0 9.3 7.2 6.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1045 AM EDT.
